And you: better follow my lead. Mike heads off after Marcus. Cam follows.

hiding behind columns a few feet ahead, Glocks ready. Whe Mike, Marcus and Cam approach -- they swing around, FIRIN Mike, Marcus and Cam take cover behind seats and concrete pillars, SHOOTING BACK -- GUNFIRE DEAFENING.

text: Red and blue lights converge on the stadium and we GO TO:
Mike, Marcus and Cam give statements to MIAMI PD. Agent Kessler soon arrives, backed by THREE FBI AGENTS.
(livid) I hate to repeat myself, Lowery. Now, this is the second time I’ve had to warn you not to interfere with this investigation.
Some investigation. We’re the ones who found the hotel shooters.
What are you doing here anyway? You’re a Goddamn civilian.
(up in his face; pissed) “I'm a Goddamn civilian? I’ma Goddman civilian.” (beat; realizing; backing off) Yeah, that’s right, I’m a Goddamn civilian.
(to his agents) I want them searched. Mike, Marcus and Cam protest but the FBI agents with Kess don't give a shit, patting them down, finding Marcus’s gu
I got a permit for that. -- and a gunman’s phone in Mike’s pocket. Kessler grabs i

Hey, that’s mine. The agent shows the ID to Kessler.
(reading the Albanian name on the card) Enver Biba?  61.
It’s my porno name. I also go by Hung Frankenstein.
Detain them. The Feds quickly slap on cuffs.
What the fuck, Kessler!?! Mike, Marcus and Cam are pulled over to the FBI sedans.
Agent Kessler! Kessler turns. Sees Luttrell walking up. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) What are you doing to my detectives?
What the hell does it look like?

A Federal agent detaining Miami PD. You don’t want the headlines or the headache. Trust me. Kessler pauses. He definitely doesn’t. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) Put them in my custody. Let Internal Affairs handle them.
Like you've handled them so far?
They won’t be a problem anymore. Kessler considers Luttrell. A beat, then warns:
They interfere again, I’m gonna arrest them for willful impeding of a Federal Investigation. That clear?
Crystal. Kessler orders his men to let Mike, Marcus and Cam free. soon as the Feds walk away:  62.
Thanks, man.
Please. I love standing up to those Federal pricks. Mike, I know how bad you want Luga. I do too. But you're bringing down too much heat.
Just tell me what else Kessler knows about Luga.

(beat, then: ) What I’ve managed to piece together is: the FBI has intercepted a lot of chatter on Albanian organized e- mail communications. References to something called “Forager.” And according to their HUMINT sources, they believe someone inside the country has brought Luga here as talent to pull off some major drug operation.
We gotta get this guy fast, Mike.
Maybe this will help. Cam reaches down and takes off a shoe.
Your socks? Cam pulls the paper he took off the gunman out of his sho
Got this off one of Viktor’s boys. Stashed it in my shoe in case we had to give the other evidence up. Marcus is instantly impressed. Mike is too, but isn’t sho it. Marcus picks up on this.
Okay, I’ll say it: “Fuck yeah.” Mike takes the paper. Doesn’t know what to make of it.
Mike, a word. Mike hands the paper back to Cam and walks off with Luttr  63. LUTTRELL (CONT’D) There’s something else. Didn’t want to say in front of the others.
What’s up?

I’ve been looking into who had knowledge that you guys were hiding out at the hotel. Only a handful of people knew and all of them were cops. The leak definitely came from inside Miami PD, maybe even your unit. Somebody’s gone bad. I’m gonna find out who, but in the meantime, don’t trust anyone. Mike considers that, as we GO TO:
I asked you point blank if you were investigating Luga -- INT. MIAMI-DADE P.D. HEADQUARTERS - ELLIE’S OFFICE - SAME Ellie tears into Mike and Cam.
-- and you gave me your word that you were standing down.
Did you really expect anything different?
Not from Mike Lowery, no. She leans forward.
I know you don’t respect me. But you should at least respect that I have a job to do.
And so do I. This asshole’s come here to kill me and because of that, Captain Howard's fighting for his life. You wanna talk respect? (MORE )

How ‘bout the respect you owe your cops instead of the Feds -- or the respect I owe Howard to go after Luga and bring his ass down for what he did? (rising from his seat) And I'd do the same if it was you in the hospital right now instead of him. Ellie looks at Mike. He’s telling the truth but despite h loyalty to Howard, she can’t let him off the hook.

I would suspend you, but I don’t think that would help. So you -- (to Cam) -- get your toothbrush, your pajamas, whatever you need, cause from this moment on, you’re on Mike watch. Every move he makes you’re gonna tell me about it. And if he screws up, it’s on you too. (back to Mike) This is not gonna end with you dead or in jail. This is for your own good. Tell me you understand that.
...I understand.
Good. Now get out.
As soon as Ellie’s door is shut:
I need to know right now: are you gonna be a problem? Cam locks eyes with Mike.
Howard is my Captain too. A beat. Mike nods. The two continue down the hall.
Daltrey’s with Sanchez, trying to decipher the paper list numbers, letters and symbols. Getting close.
Penis-sized nipple or a nipple- sized penis?  65.
(beat) Nipple. Mike hurries in with Cam, urgent:
Where you at with those codes?
Still working on it.
Alright, here's how it goes: Cam, you pair up with Daltrey. I wanna know what those codes mean. I’m headin’ over to Miami General. Sanchez: how are your gang connections? Any owe you favors?
I got a guy who’s in ABK. Runs a bodega in Miami Gardens.

Reach out to him. Have him slip it to two or three operators in the Albanian community that one of the hotel shooters survived the hit tonight and is listed as a John Doe at the hospital. When word travels up the chain that one of their targets is alive and talkin’ to the cops, the Albanians are gonna send someone to finish the job. I’1l have a heart to heart with him and find out where Luga’s hiding his ass. Call me when y’all have something. Mike steps back out into the hallway. Cam hurries after h
Dude, what the hell? You’re benching me? I thought we had an understanding. Mike stops.
You need to trust me.
I am. With that list.  66.
So while I’m picking up your scraps you can go off and do the real cop work?

Look, right now Luga’s out there somewhere. I don’t know what he’s doin’, but I know it’s not good. If I can’t find out on my own, you're gonna have to get something off that list. Either way, it’s not open for debate. Cam considers Mike. The assignment does have importance.
Now I gotta go get my decoy.
Marcus strips out of his clothes to change into an unflattering hospital gown -- and he’s NOT happy.
This is some next level embarrassment right here.
You're the one who said you wanted to be involved.
Well, thanks for tossin’ me a fuckin’ bone. Any dignity I had before today? Gone.
Would you just get in bed and quit complaining?
Hey, as long as I’m the one whose ass is literally exposed here, I’m gonna complain as much as I want. He finally gets the gown on and hops into the bed.
You all good in here, Mike? Mike turns to the door to find an ATTRACTIVE NURSE.
Yeah, Dena. Listen, I can’t thank you enough for hooking this up. (MORE )
If there’s anything I can do to repay the favor...
Anything? Gonna keep you to that. She smiles seductively and slips out.
(yelling out the room) Gonna need a bed pan in here!
Daltrey runs the list of codes through a scanner. Pulls t image up on a wall monitor.

Over the next SEVERAL HOURS, Cam tries to break down the with a pen, re-arranging letters, words and symbols onto piece of paper as: Daltrey types an algorithm into a computer. Hits ENTER. Immediately all the numbers, letters and symbols start to move around and change order. Eventually -- Daltrey’s algorithm cracks the first cipher.
Holy shit, I got it. Cam snaps up, alert.
The code’s based off the Albanian alphabet. We just need to figure out which numbers correspond to which letters --
And then add them to the letters that already exist.
Exactly. Daltrey types more commands into the computer, cross- referencing letters in the code with the Albanian alphabe
Hold up. What about the symbols?

The symbols are nothing. Garbage. Noise to keep us from seeing the real code.  68. Cam jots down a few ALBANIAN WORDS as they appear. Then t into another computer. Translates the Albanian words in t first coded entry into English. Comes up with:
Morrow Airpark. Daltrey does the same routine for the second code.
Next code’s an address. 27309 Fleming Avenue. Daltrey enters the address into his computer.
It’s a gas depot.
And the last code? Daltrey tries to crack it using the same method as the ot two, but can’t.
...I don’t know. This cipher’s different from the other two. It’s not based on the same alphabet. Gonna take some time to break. Cam checks his watch. Makes a call.
Okay. Let’s get started on the first two. MUSIC, MOMENTUM -- as we GO TO:

Sanchez cuts through a back, graffiti-lined street. Draws phone while covertly making her way up to the back of a neighborhood bodega. Sends a text. The back door cracks o as she arrives. She slips inside.
Sanchez sits on a crate. Meets secretly with CARLOS, the bodega’s owner. Young. Confident.
How many people we talkin’ about?
Two or three. But it can’t get back to us. Think you can handle it for me?  69.
Have I ever let you down before?
(rising) I owe you one, Carlos.
(shakes his head) I still owe you for helpin’ my sister out.
Make this happen and we’re even. OFF CARLOS, nodding, no problem -- MUSIC RESUMES -- LAUNC
An aircraft “boneyard” filled with retired military and civilian planes, stripped for parts and gathering rust. Daltrey flashes his badge to the AIRPARK FOREMAN.
Daltrey speeds through SURVEILLANCE FOOTAGE of the airpar
A fuel depository for commercial use only. Cam roars up.

Daltrey stops when he sees TWO ALBANIANS pull up in a familiar-—looking Suburban and disappear inside a MILITAR AIRCRAFT. Fast-forwards until the men re-emerge -- now carrying wit them: a HARRIS FALCON MILITARY RADIO.
Cam interviews the DEPOT MANAGER.
Yeah, that’s right, about two hours ago. Two foreign guys purchased 12,000 lbs of AV fuel.
AV fuel?
Aviation fuel.  70. OFF CAM -- curious -- END SEQUENCE and CUT TO:
Mike gets a drink out of the vending machine when his pho rings. It’s the TNT office.
Yeah. What do you know?
Cam, Daltrey and Sanchez around the speaker phone:

First code was an address for an aviation boneyard. Daltrey made two Albanians making off with a Harris Falcon radio. Foreman says it’s used to communicate with military aircraft only. Mike files that in his head.
Second code directed us to a fuel depot where another set of Albanians purchased 12,000 lbs of aviation fuel. Mike makes another note.
And the last one?
We don’t know yet. We’re still trying to crack it, but it’s a different cipher than the others.
Alright, stay on it.
As Bardha wraps up a call on his cell.
You're absolutely sure? (beat) Okay. Thanks for the call. Bardha hangs up. Climbs the stairs to:
Bardha enters. Looks to Hess.  71.
We got a problem.
Night has fallen.
Marcus eats from a pudding cup in bed. Mike sits in a cha

Two points. The pudding cup come doesn’t even come close.
Wow, you really are a genuine slob.
It’s not being a slob if it isn’t your house. Mike shakes his head. A beat, then to break the silence:
Just like old times though. You, me, a stakeout. Mike agrees, but says nothing.
.»+-You know, you should really give your new partner a break. I know you hate to admit it but he’s got skills.
He’s a kid.
So were we once. Mike takes that in as Marcus admits:
You guys make a good team. Marcus looks away. Jealous, perhaps? Switching the subjec
Talk to your family lately?  72.
I checked in on them this afternoon.
How they holdin’ up?
Good... under the circumstances.
I missed them.
They missed you.
Must be nice. Having someone to go home to. Marcus looks at him sideways.
Are you jealous, Mike? ‘Cause you can have ‘em.
Just sayin’. It’s been on my mind lately is all.
Mike Lowery wants to settle down? Better get one of those crash carts. Think I’m gonna have myself a heart attack. Now it’s Mike’s turn to look away. A beat, then:
Look, uhh, since we’re sharin’ n’ shit... I know you don’t think so, but I do miss the action sometimes.
You're definitely getting your full of it this week.
Tell me about it.
You didn’t have to quit. Marcus shrugs. What do you want from me?  73.
(sincerely) Why did you quit, Marcus? (no response) It wasn’t just Luga and the Albanians or the blood oath, was it?
Then why?
You really wanna know?
I asked. Marcus sits up in the bed.
Respect. Mike’s thrown.

Every time we go into a situation, it’s all about what you want. I don’t get a say. And when you do it all head-on like you do, you’re puttin’ my life on the line. And after so long, it’s clear that you don’t care about me.

And how do you think I felt? The person I counted on to save my life wasn’t there for me. “We ride together. We die together. Bad Boys for life.” That meant something to me. As Marcus absorbs that -- the two partners finally starti to reconcile -- MUSIC BUILDS and we GO TO:

Bardha drives. An ALBANIAN GUNMAN loads a SIG-Sauer P220R  74.

And Burnett Services Unlimited.

trapped in a BEAR HUG. He SLAMS his head back into the Gunman’s nose. He DROPS Mike -- who picks up his gun, spins and CRACKS i over the Gunman’s head -- knocking him out.

-- and Bardha goes SLIDING down the tube -- into a LAUNDR CART in the hospital basement.
Mike steps into an elevator -- as another elevator opens and MIAMI COPS step out, just missing him.
Mike and Marcus carry the taped up Bardha over to Marcus' Camaro, toss him into the trunk and drive off. SMASH TO:

This is some sick ass shit right here.
You didn’t say anything when I asked you to go to the drive-thru.
I thought you were buying me dinner, not no lion! Like “good job for not killing your suspect. Love, Mike.” I was touched.

Where’s Luga?

One last time.

Your choice. Mike shoves the last Big Mac into Bardha’s pants. Bardha SCREAMS -- AHHHHH! -- as Mike picks him up.

Where’s Luga?
Pull me up! AHHH!  78. Smelling the Big Macs, the lion comes up. LEAPS. Mike and Marcus yank Bardha up just before the paw can tear him.
Oh shit -- did you see that!?!
(lowering Bardha back down ) WHERE’S LUGA!?!? Bardha is TERRIFIED now.
I DON’T KNOW! GET ME OUT, GET ME

WHAT’S HE HERE TO DO!?! OH MY GOD!!!

You’re gonna tell me how to break this code. OFF BARDHA -- caving:
The basement door opens to reveal Aleksander Luga, fired and ready to go. A team of ALBANIANS hop inside TWO TRUCKS, armed to the teeth, Luga about to join when Hess grabs his arm, warnin

This time, Mike drives. Marcus white-knuckles the dashboa Into a speaker phone:

Thinkin’ the FBI doesn’t know what’s up. Luga’s not here to doa drug deal. He’s here to doa hijacking. He’s a pilot, remember. Daltrey, how fast can you get your boys in the military on the phone?
Anytime day or night.
Do it now. Ask them if there’s any military aircrafts with the code- name “Forager"” coming into Florida tonight.

Alright, just spoke to my pals in the Marine Reserves. Forager’s the NATO reporting name for an AN-124 Ruslan Transport Plane.
“FORAGER”, the transport plane, approaches the Florida co

M15 and M16 assault rifles. M40A1 Sniper Rifles. MP5s. Shoulder- launched missiles. Radar-cloaking technology. And at least 400,000 rounds of ammunition.
Jesus -- Luga’s gonna have enough hardware to take over a small country.
Or sell to one. We gotta go straight to the FBI on this. Cam, get Kessler and tell him Luga’s hijacking a military transport plane full of weapons.
Yeah, on it.
And tell no one else at Miami PD about this.
But Mike --
Just do it. Mike hangs up. Marcus turns to Mike, surprised.
You gonna cut out Miami PD?  82.
If the leak’s coming from inside the department, I’m not tippin’ Luga off that we’re coming. Marcus isn’t sure. Mike drops the hammer, the car SPEEDIN AHEAD -- as we GO BACK TO:
Daltrey and Sanchez slap on Kevlar. Cam’s on the phone wi the FBI.

And where the hell is Lowery?

Roger tower, 5-0-7-9 diverting.

Target’s en route. Get ready.  84.

Get your gun.
